SEARCH
Package com.example.eventlottery.model

Class EventTimeValidator

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlottery.model.EventTimeValidator
public final class EventTimeValidator extends Object
This class provides pure date/time validation logic for creation of an event. Time interval rules: - For event creation (in days): eventStart - now >= MIN_EVENT_LEAD_DAYS - For registration period (in ms): regStart >= now regStart invalid input: '<' regEnd defaultRegStart = now defaultRegEnd = eventStart - MIN_REG_DRAWN_GAP eventStart - regEnd >= MIN_REG_DRAWN_GAP

  • Method Details

    • isEventDateValid

      public static boolean isEventDateValid(Calendar today, Calendar eventDate)
      This method checks if an event starts at least MIN_EVENT_LEAD_DAYS from today (date-only comparison).
      Parameters:
      today - : the calendar of today
      eventDate - : the calendar of event start date
      Returns:
      true if event start date is valid (>= MIN_EVENT_LEAD_DAYS); else false

    • isRegPeriodValid

      public static boolean isRegPeriodValid(long regStart, long regEnd, long eventStart)
      This method checks if the registration period is valid given the event start time.
      Parameters:
      regStart - : the registration start time in ms
      regEnd - : the registration end time in ms
      eventStart - : the event start time in ms
      Returns:
      true if registration period is valid; else false

    • normalizeToDate

      public static void normalizeToDate(Calendar cal)
      Normalize a Calendar to date-only (time being as 00:00:00.000)
      Parameters:
      cal - : the Calendar object
